channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Justice Barrett Discusses New Book
channel.desc: Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett discusses her new book, Listening to the Law: Reflections on the Court and Constitution, during a conversation hosted by the Reagan Foundation's Center on Civility and Democracy in Simi Valley, California.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lee Tilghman, if You Don
channel.desc: Former influencer Lee Tilghman describes the impact on herself of making a career on social media; Strand Books in New York City hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Joe Concha, the Greatest Comeback Ever - Inside Trump's Big Beautiful Campaign
channel.desc: Joe Concha gives his take on President Donald Trump's return to the White House for a second, non-consecutive term.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Charlie Kirk, The MAGA Doctrine
channel.desc: Turning Point founder Charlie Kirk offers his thoughts on what he calls the new conservative agenda.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Matthew Facciani, Misguided: Where Misinformation Starts, How It Spreads, and What to Do About It
channel.desc: Matthew Facciani argues that people are more likely to fall for misinformation when it reaffirms their political identity.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Joe Concha, the Greatest Comeback Ever - Inside Trump's Big Beautiful Campaign
channel.desc: Joe Concha gives his take on President Donald Trump's return to the White House for a second, non-consecutive term.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Charlie Kirk, The MAGA Doctrine
channel.desc: Turning Point founder Charlie Kirk offers his thoughts on what he calls the new conservative agenda.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Matthew Facciani, Misguided: Where Misinformation Starts, How It Spreads, and What to Do About It
channel.desc: Matthew Facciani argues that people are more likely to fall for misinformation when it reaffirms their political identity.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Ben Weissenbach, North to the Future: An Offline Adventure Through the Changing Wilds of Alaska
channel.desc: Journalist Ben Weissenbach documents his experience traveling with scientists through the Alaskan wilderness; Powerhouse Arena in New York City hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Miranda Spivack, Backroom Deals in Our Backyards
channel.desc: Author Miranda Spivack looks at how local communities address alleged government malfeasance and neglect from unsafe driving conditions to drinking water.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Garrett Graff, The Only Plane in the Sky
channel.desc: Author Garrett Graff ("The Only Plane in the Sky: An Oral History of 9/11") provides a history of September 11, 2001, by utilizing newly declassified documents and transcripts as well as over five hundred interviews with those directly affected.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Justice Barrett Discusses New Book
channel.desc: Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett discusses her new book, Listening to the Law: Reflections on the Court and Constitution, during a conversation hosted by the Reagan Foundation's Center on Civility and Democracy in Simi Valley, California.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lee Tilghman, if You Don
channel.desc: Former influencer Lee Tilghman describes the impact on herself of making a career on social media; Strand Books in New York City hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Book TV
channel.desc: This long-running staple of the C-SPAN2 weekend schedule helps expand the channel's programming beyond politics. Most episodes of "Book TV" feature discussions with authors of nonfiction books, usually in the form of interviews, lectures or seminars. The series sometimes includes coverage of major book fairs and festivals. Some of the notable names who have appeared on the show include David Mamet and Tom Clancy.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: The 1992 Republican National Convention speeches by former President Ronald Reagan and Pat Buchanan - who had run for the GOP nomination that year - is the topic of a class taught by University of Kansas political communication professor Robert Rowla.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: The SeaLab III Command Information Bureau film shows a 1968 Navy experiment in which aquanauts lived in a sea-floor habitat off San Clemente Island, Calif.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: This profile of former first lady Barbara Bush is set against the backdrop of the Forever Stamp issued in her honor in 2025; the White House ceremony unveiling the stamp; we hear from her daughter Doro and grandson Pierce.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: The 1968 Army Pictorial Center film describes how the U.S. military might counteract Communism in other nations through psychological operations.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Finalists for the 2025 George Washington Book Prize discuss their books on the nation's founding era.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Oral Histories
channel.desc: Remembering Sept. 11, 2001 through the stories of Americans who were at the White House, U.S. Capitol, the Pentagon and in the skies above Washington.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Oral Histories
channel.desc: Remembering Sept. 11, 2001, through the stories of Americans who were at the White House, the U.S. Capitol, the Pentagon, and in the skies above Washington, D.C.

channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: A look at the people and events that shaped the American Civil War and Reconstruction.
